interpGrp.interp: Changes in spelling or orthography. This includes any alterations to how words are written without affecting their meaning, such as standardizing spelling or correcting errors. Also includes adding or removing an alif as a marker of the accusative or at the end of a plural verb. Changes to the diacritics for a final ي or ى can be ignored. If the change affects the meaning or grammatical function of the word (such as the form of a verb), then it is more significant than an orthographic change and should not be in this category.

An addition, omission or substitution to a single minor word or part of a word. A minor word means a conjunction, pronoun, demonstrative pronoun (e.g. ذلك), pronominal suffix, definite article, preposition, interrogative particle (such as 'ما') or other particle (such as 'قد'). This includes the expansion or contraction of a word and changes to verb form, such as modifications in verb tense, form, or voice, including changes to person or number and transformations between participle and verb. If the root word is the same but the number changes, then it falls in this category. It can still be in this category if the change affects the meaning substantially, so long as it is only affecting the part of speech described here or it does not change the root of the word. If there are changes to multiple words between readings (even if they are minor), then it should not be in this category but it is under 'Multiple_Word_Changes'. If there are multiple minor changes to a single word, then it can still be a Single_Minor_Word_Change.

An addition, omission or substitution to a single word that is more significant than a conjunction, pronoun, pronominal suffix, definite article, preposition, or particle (such as 'قد'). It is only a major word change if the root of the word is different. If a word is changed to a different form of the same root, then it is a Single_Minor_Word_Change. If the two readings are identical except for a difference in a single major word, then it is in this category (even if the readings otherwise contain multiple words).

Changes across more than one word. Words can be major or minor. Even if the changes are minor, if multiple words are changed, then it falls in this category. If more than one word is added or omitted, then it is in this category.

app.rdg: قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود
قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود
قال الرب لليهود الذين اتوا اليه

relation.desc: Several words are added.
More than one word is changed because by transposing اليهود it also affects the ل preposition.

This change involves the addition of multiple words ("قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود"), which clearly fits the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes as it involves changes across more than one word, regardless of whether those words are major or minor.
c.f. OMIT ➞ قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود

This change involves the addition of multiple words, including a major word "قال" and several other words "الرب", "للذين", "اتو", "اليه", "من", and "اليهود", which clearly fits the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes as it involves changes across more than one word.
c.f. OMIT ➞ قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود

The change from اتوا to اتو is an alteration in the spelling of the word, specifically the omission of the final alif, which is a characteristic of orthographic changes, similar to the example "قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود → قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود" where the final alif in اتوا is omitted.
c.f. قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود ➞ قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود
Several words are added.

The justification for this decision is that the entire phrase "فكلمهم ايضا يسوع" is a major word or phrase that has been omitted, which fits the definition of a Single_Major_Word_Change, where a single major word is added or omitted, even though in this case, the word or phrase being omitted consists of multiple words.
c.f. فكلمهم ايضا يسوع ➞ OMIT
A single major word is added.
Two words are added.

The change from ⸂وقال⸃ to ⸂صوته وقال⸃ involves adding a new major word صوته, thus it cannot be classified under Orthography or Single_Minor_Word_Change, and since only one major word is added, it is not Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. وقال ➞ صوته وقال
The pronoun هو is added which is a minor word.

The change from ⸂يمشي في الظلمه الي⸃ to ⸂يمشي فى الظلمه⸃ involves altering the spelling of the word "في" to "فى", which is a change in orthography, as it does not affect the meaning or grammatical function of the word, similar to examples like اجاب يسوع فقال لهم → اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم where the spelling of ysou' is changed to 'aisyou'.
c.f. يمشي في الظلمه الي ➞ يمشي فى الظلمه
The preposition (with pronominal suffix) معه is changed to له.
The preposition ل is added to الدهر.

This change is categorized as a Single_Minor_Word_Change because it involves changing the preposition (with pronominal suffix) معه to له, which is a modification to a minor word, specifically a preposition with a pronominal suffix, and this type of change fits the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change as seen in the example: الدهر بل تكون له → الدهر بل تكون معه.
c.f. الابد بل تكون معه ➞ الدهر بل تكون له

The change from ⸂الابد بل تكون معه⸃ to ⸂الدهر بل يكون له⸃ involves altering the preposition "مع" to "له", which is a modification of a minor word (a preposition with a pronominal suffix), fitting the definition of Single_Minor_Word_Change as seen in the example "الدهر بل تكون له → الدهر بل تكون معه".
c.f. الابد بل تكون معه ➞ الدهر بل يكون له

The change from ⸂الابد بل تكون معه⸃ to ⸂الدهر بل تكون معه⸃ involves replacing the major word "الابد" with "الدهر", which has a different root, thus fitting the definition of a Single_Major_Word_Change.
c.f. الابد بل تكون معه ➞ الدهر بل تكون معه

The change from ⸂الابد بل تكون معه⸃ to ⸂للدهر بل تكون له⸃ involves changing the preposition (with pronominal suffix) معه to له, which is a change to a single minor word, fitting the definition of Single_Minor_Word_Change, similar to the example "الدهر بل تكون له → الدهر بل تكون معه" where the preposition (with pronominal suffix) معه is changed to له.
c.f. الابد بل تكون معه ➞ للدهر بل تكون له

The change from ⸂الدهر بل تكون له⸃ to ⸂الدهر بل يكون له⸃ involves modifying the verb "تكون" to agree with the masculine subject "الدهر", which results in a change to the verb form, this is similar to the example where "تسمعون اقوالى" is changed to "تسمعون قولي" which also involved a change in the number of a word, both of these changes fall under the category of Single_Minor_Word_Change.
c.f. الدهر بل تكون له ➞ الدهر بل يكون له

The change from ⸂الدهر بل يكون له⸃ to ⸂الدهر بل تكون معه⸃ involves altering the preposition (with pronominal suffix) 'له' to 'معها' (or 'معه' as the case may be, though the exact vocalization isn't clear) which matches the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change as it involves a change to a minor word - in this case, a preposition with a pronominal suffix, and the rest of the sentence remains unchanged.
c.f. الدهر بل يكون له ➞ الدهر بل تكون معه

The change from ⸂الدهر بل يكون له⸃ to ⸂للدهر بل تكون له⸃ involves adding the definite article "ل" to "الدهر", which is a minor word change, specifically an addition of a definite article, and also the verb "يكون" is changed to "تكون", which is a change in verb form, both of which fall under the category of Single_Minor_Word_Change as per the given definition.
c.f. الدهر بل يكون له ➞ للدهر بل تكون له

The change from ⸂الدهر بل تكون معه⸃ to ⸂للدهر بل تكون له⸃ involves changing the preposition (with pronominal suffix) معه to له, which is a modification to a minor word, fitting the definition of Single_Minor_Word_Change, similar to the example "الدهر بل تكون له → الدهر بل تكون معه" where the preposition (with pronominal suffix) معه is changed to له.
c.f. الدهر بل تكون معه ➞ للدهر بل تكون له

The justification for this decision is that the change involves adding a single major word "نور" to the original text, which alters the meaning and context of the sentence, fitting the definition of a Single_Major_Word_Change as it involves a change to a word that is more significant than a conjunction, pronoun, pronominal suffix, definite article, preposition, or particle, and the root of the word "نور" is different from the surrounding words.
c.f. الحياه ➞ نور الحياه

The change from OMIT to الي involves adding a single major word, which fits the definition of a Single_Major_Word_Change, as seen in examples like وقال → OMIT or OMIT → باثامكم where a single major word is either added or omitted.
c.f. OMIT ➞ الي
The pronoun انت is added and an alif is added to تشهد.
A ب preposition is add to حق.
The orthographic change is made to يسوع making it ايسوع and the ف conjunction is changed to a و.
The conjunction ف is changed to و.
The spelling of يسوع is changed to ايسوع.
The verb اجاب is added and the phrase فقال لهم is moved to the end. The conjunction ف is changed to a و.

This change involves more than one word: the word اجاب is omitted and the word ف is added at the start, and the order of the words is changed, with ايسوع being moved after فقال لهم, thus affecting multiple words and fitting the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. اجاب يسوع فقال لهم ➞ فقال لهم ايسوع

The change from ايسوع to يسوع is an alteration in spelling or orthography, where the addition or removal of an alif (in this case, the removal of 'اي' from 'ايسوع' to get 'يسوع') does not affect the meaning or grammatical function of the word, fitting the definition of an Orthography change.
c.f. اجاب ايسوع وقال لهم ➞ اجاب يسوع وقال لهم

This change is categorized as a Single_Minor_Word_Change because the alteration involves changing a single minor word, specifically the conjunction "و" to "ف", which is a modification to a minor word as defined in the guidelines, similar to the example where "فقال" is changed to "وقال" which also involves a change in conjunction.
c.f. اجاب ايسوع وقال لهم ➞ اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم

The change from ⸂فقال لهم ايسوع⸃ to ⸂اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم⸃ involves adding the word "اجاب" which is a major word, thus it cannot be classified as an Orthography or Single_Minor_Word_Change. Additionally, since more than one word is not exactly changed but rather one word is added, it still fits the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes as seen in the example "فقال → اجاب يسوع وقال لهم" where multiple words are added.
c.f. فقال لهم ايسوع ➞ اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم

The change from ⸂اجاب يسوع وقال لهم⸃ to ⸂اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم⸃ involves altering the spelling of "يسوع" to "ايسوع" and changing the conjunction "وقال" to "فقال", however since the latter change affects a minor word (conjunction), we look closer and see the former is an orthographic change while the latter is a minor word change, but given the definition, when looking closely, the change of "وقال" to "فقال" is indeed a change to a minor word, yet the overall change seems to involve more than one minor word, thus making it seem like Multiple_Word_Changes, however considering the definition of Single_Minor_Word_Change allows substantial changes to the meaning so long as it's to a minor word, and given the fact that the change from "يسوع" to "ايسوع" is purely orthographic, and the change from "وقال" to "فقال" is a change to a minor word, it might have been tempting to categorize it under Multiple_Word_Changes due to the two distinct changes, yet upon reevaluation, the change from "وقال" to "فقال" is indeed a Single_Minor_Word_Change, hence making the whole change a Multiple_Word_Changes because two distinct changes occurred: one orthographic and one minor word change.
c.f. اجاب يسوع وقال لهم ➞ اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم
The conjunction و is added.
The preposition هي is added.

app.rdg: من اين انا والى اين انطلق فاما انتم
من اين انا والي اين اذهب واما انتم
اين اتيت ولا الى اين انطلق
اين اتيت ولا الي اين اذهب

relation.desc: Multiple words are changed.

The change from ⸂وانتم انما⸃ to ⸂انتم⸃ involves the omission of the minor word "انما", which is a preposition-like phrase used to indicate a question or surprise, this fits within the definition of Single_Minor_Word_Change as it involves a change to a minor word.
c.f. وانتم انما ➞ انتم
The major word تقظون is omitted.

The justification for this decision is that the entire phrase "ايما تقضون" is a major word or phrase that is being omitted, which fits the definition of a Single_Major_Word_Change as it involves the addition, omission, or substitution of a single major word, even though in this case, the word is a phrase.
c.f. ايما تقضون ➞ OMIT
The pronoun انتم is added.

This change is categorized as a Single_Minor_Word_Change because it involves the substitution of a single minor word, in this case, the verb form "تقضون" is changed to "تقضوا", which affects the person or number of the verb, and this type of modification is characteristic of changes to minor words as defined in the Single_Minor_Word_Change category.
c.f. OMIT ➞ تقضوا
The conjunction و is added.
The change from ⸂اما انا⸃ to ⸂وانا⸃ involves replacing the conjunction اما with و, which is a minor word change as it only affects a conjunction, fitting the definition of Single_Minor_Word_Change.
c.f. اما انا ➞ وانا

The change from واما to و is a change to a minor word, specifically a conjunction, which fits the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change, similar to examples like اما انتم فتفعلون → واما انتم فتفعلون where a conjunction و is added.
c.f. واما انا ➞ وانا
An alif of nasb is added to احد.
Two changes occur. The conjunction ف is added at the start and the orthographic change occurs by addings an alif of nasb to احد.
Diacritics are added.
The conjunction ف is added at the start.

This change involves two parts: the addition of the conjunction ف at the start and the addition of an alif of nasb to احد. Although there are two changes, the first change is to a minor word (the conjunction ف) and the second change is an orthographic change (addition of an alif of nasb). However, since one of the changes affects a minor word, this puts the change in the Single_Minor_Word_Change category rather than the Orthography category.
c.f. ليس ادين احد ➞ فليس ادين احدا

This change is categorized as a Single_Minor_Word_Change because the only difference between the two readings is the addition of the conjunction ف, which is considered a minor word according to the definition provided, similar to the example where ليس ادين احدا is changed to فليس ادين احدًا, where the conjunction ف is added at the start.
c.f. ليس ادين احد ➞ فليس ادين احد

This change is categorized as a Single_Minor_Word_Change because the only difference between the two readings is the addition of the conjunction ف, which is considered a minor word according to the definition provided, similar to the example where ليس ادين احدا → فليس ادين احدًا is classified as a Single_Minor_Word_Change.
c.f. ليس ادين احدا ➞ فليس ادين احدا

This change is categorized as a Single_Minor_Word_Change because the only difference between the two readings is the addition of the conjunction ف at the start, which is considered a minor word according to the definition provided, similar to the example where ليس ادين احدا → فليس ادين احدًا is classified as a Single_Minor_Word_Change due to the addition of the conjunction ف.
c.f. ليس ادين احدا ➞ فليس ادين احد

The change from ⸂فليس ادين احدا⸃ to ⸂فليس ادين احد⸃ involves the removal of an alif of nasb from احدا to احد, which is a change in orthography that does not affect the meaning or grammatical function of the word, fitting the definition of Orthography.
c.f. فليس ادين احدا ➞ فليس ادين احد

The change from ⸂فليس ادين احدًا⸃ to ⸂فليس ادين احد⸃ involves the removal of an alif of nasb from احدًا to احد, which is an alteration in spelling or orthography without affecting the meaning of the word, fitting the definition of Orthography.
c.f. فليس ادين احدًا ➞ فليس ادين احد

The change from ⸂لاني⸃ to ⸂هو لان⸃ involves the substitution of multiple words, where "لاني" is replaced by "هو لان", indicating a change that affects more than one word, thus fitting the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. لاني ➞ هو لان
Changes occur to two words.
The form of لست is changed to ليست.
The form of ليست is changed to ليس.

The change from ⸂لست وحدي⸃ to ⸂ليس وحدي⸃ involves altering the form of the word "لست" to "ليس", which affects the meaning substantially but only changes the part of speech described as a minor word, specifically a change in verb form, similar to the example where "ليست واحدى" is changed to "ليس وحدي".
c.f. لست وحدي ➞ ليس وحدي

The change from ليست to ليس is a modification in the form of the verb, specifically a change in the person or number, which falls under the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change, similar to the example where ليست واحدى is changed to ليس وحدي, indicating a change in the form of the verb without altering its root, thus fitting this category.
c.f. ليست وحدي ➞ ليس وحدي
The pronoun انا is added.
A pronominal suffix is added.
A و conjunction is omitted and pronominal suffix is added to a single word.

The change from ⸂ولكني⸃ to ⸂لكنى⸃ involves altering the spelling of the word, specifically changing the vowelization and possibly the diacritical marks, but the core meaning and the root of the word remain unchanged, fitting the definition of an orthographic change.
c.f. ولكني ➞ لكنى
Multiple words are added.
Multiple words are omitted.
Two words are added.

The justification for this decision is that the word ⸂حق⸃ is a major word and it is omitted in the second reading, which matches the definition of a Single_Major_Word_Change, where a single major word is added or omitted, similar to the example "وقال → OMIT" where a single major word is added.
c.f. حق ➞ OMIT

The justification for this decision is that the change involves adding two words "هي" to the original text "حق", thus affecting more than one word, which aligns with the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. حق ➞ حق هي
The pronoun انا is omitted.
The pronoun (with conjunction) وانا is omitted.
The change from ⸂انا⸃ to ⸂وانا⸃ involves the addition of a conjunction و, which is considered a minor word, thus fitting the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change.
c.f. انا ➞ وانا
The major word اشهد is omitted.
The preposition علي is omitted.

The justification for this decision is that the word نفسى is a major word and its omission results in a change to a single major word, which aligns with the definition of Single_Major_Word_Change, similar to examples where a single major word is added or omitted, such as وقال → OMIT or اشهد → OMIT.
c.f. نفسى ➞ OMIT

The change from على to لي involves a change to a single minor word, specifically a preposition, which fits the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change, similar to examples like اتوا اليه → اتوا اليه من where a preposition من is added.
c.f. على ذلك ➞ لي ذلك

The change from ⸂على ذلك⸃ to ⸂لي وهو⸃ involves replacing a single major word "ذلك" with a phrase "لي وهو", however since "لي" and "ذلك" share the same root and position, but "لي" has a different meaning and "و" and "هو" are added, it's clear that the core change is the replacement of "ذلك" with "لي" and additional minor words are added, thus making the primary change a Single_Major_Word_Change due to the alteration of the root word "ذلك" to "لي" despite the addition of minor words.
c.f. على ذلك ➞ لي وهو

The change from ⸂لي ذلك⸃ to ⸂لي وهو⸃ involves adding a minor word "و" and also adding a pronoun "هو", however since "و" is a minor word and "هو" is also considered minor in this context as it's a pronoun, this change is classified under Single_Minor_Word_Change as it affects only the addition of minor words without altering the root of any major word.
c.f. لي ذلك ➞ لي وهو

The change from ⸂يسوع⸃ to ⸂ايسوع⸃ is an example of an orthographic change because an alif is added to the beginning of the word, thus altering its spelling without changing its meaning, similar to the example where ايسوع is changed to يسوع.
c.f. يسوع ➞ ايسوع
Two words are omitted.
Two words are omitted.

The change from ف to و is a change to a single minor word, specifically a conjunction, which fits the definition of Single_Minor_Word_Change, similar to the example where ف is changed to و in the phrase "فقال → وقال".
c.f. فقال لهم ➞ وقال لهم
The preposition ب is added to هذا.

The change from ⸂كان يكلمهم⸃ to ⸂كلمهم⸃ involves the omission of the minor word "كان" which is a conjunction or a modifier indicating past tense, thus it fits within the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change as it involves a modification to a minor word without altering the root of the main word "كلم".
c.f. كان يكلمهم ➞ كلمهم
The noun الكنز is changed to القربان.
The conjunction ف is changed to و.
An alif of nasb is added to احد.
Two words are changed.
The article ال is added.
Two words are changed.

The change from ساعته to ساعه is an alteration in the spelling of the word without affecting its meaning, which aligns with the definition of Orthography, as it involves changes in spelling or orthography that do not impact the word's meaning or grammatical function.
c.f. لان ساعته لم ➞ لان ساعه لم

The change from ⸂لان ساعته لم⸃ to ⸂لان الساعه لم⸃ involves adding the definite article ال to the word ساعه, which is a minor word change as it affects a minor word (the definite article), and this type of change is consistent with the definition of Single_Minor_Word_Change.
c.f. لان ساعته لم ➞ لان الساعه لم

This change involves altering multiple words: "لان" is changed to "اذ", and "ساعه" is changed to "كانت", which fits the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes as changes occurring across more than one word.
c.f. لان ساعه لم ➞ اذ كانت لم
Two words are changed.
The word بلغت is changed to اتت.
The verb اتت is changed to اقتربت.
c.f. تكون اقتربت ➞ تكن اتت

The justification for this decision is that the change from ⸂تكن بلغت⸃ to ⸂تكون اقتربت⸃ involves changing the major word بلغت to اقتربت, which has a different root, thus fitting the definition of a Single_Major_Word_Change, similar to the example where تكن بلغت is changed to تكن اتت, or where OMIT is changed to باثامكم, both of which involve changing a single major word.
c.f. تكن بلغت ➞ تكون اقتربت

The change from تكون to تكن involves changing the root of the word, which classifies it as a Single_Major_Word_Change according to the given definition, similar to the example where تكن بلغت is changed to تكون اتت.
c.f. تكون اتت ➞ تكن اتت

The justification for this decision is that the change from تكن to تكون involves a change to a major word (تكون is a different root from تكن), and the change from اتت to اقتربت also involves a change to a major word (اقتربت is a different root from اتت), however since only one pair of words is affected, it is classified under Single_Major_Word_Change rather than Multiple_Word_Changes, similar to the example where "تكن بلغت" is changed to "تكن اتت" which is also categorized as Single_Major_Word_Change.

relation.desc: Multiple wrds are added.
The final alif in اتوا is omitted.
Multiple wrds are added.
Two words are omitted.

This change involves multiple words: "اذهب" is changed to "انطلق", "طلبوني" is changed to "طلبونى", and "في" is changed to "ولا". Since changes occur across more than one word, this fits the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes.
c.f. اذهب وتطلبوني وفي ➞ انطلق وتطلبونى ولا
The change from ⸂وبخطاياكم⸃ to ⸂خطاياكم⸃ involves the omission of the preposition ب, which is considered a minor word, thus fitting the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change.
c.f. وبخطاياكم ➞ خطاياكم

This change involves altering multiple words: "خطاياكم" is changed to "تجدونى" and additionally, "باثمكم" is added, thus fitting the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes as it involves changes across more than one word.
c.f. خطاياكم ➞ تجدونى وباثمكم

The change from تموتون to تموتوا involves a modification to the verb form, specifically a change in the person or number, which falls under the definition of a Single_Minor_Word_Change, as it affects a minor aspect of the word without altering its root or changing it to a completely different word.
c.f. تموتون وحيث ➞ تموتوا وحيث
